records.full_caption: Scheme 1. NDI-based copolymers synthesized in this work (the color represents the resulting polymer film color). Reaction conditions: (a) trans-1, 2-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)ethene, Pd2(dba)3, P(o-tol)3, toluene, 110 °C, 24 h; (b) 2,5-bis(trimethylstannyl)thiophene, Pd2(dba)3, P(o-tol)3, toluene, 110 °C, 24 h.
records.caption: Scheme 1. NDI-based copolymers synthesized in this work (the color represents the resulting polymer film color). Reaction conditions: (a) trans-1, 2-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)ethene, Pd2(dba)3, P(o-tol)3, toluene, 110 °C, 24 h; (b) 2,5-bis(trimethylstannyl)thiophene, Pd2(dba)3, P(o-tol)3, toluene, 110 °C, 24 h.

records.full_caption: Fig. 2. (a) The optimized molecular geometries and dihedral angles of NDI-based trimers. The red and blue circles present the distance between the O atom from NDI and the H atom from the vinylene or thiophene unit. (b) Torsion energy profiles of the gNDI-V and gNDI-T trimers. (c) Energy levels and visualization of LUMOs and HOMOs of NDI-based trimers.
records.caption: Torsion energy profiles of the gNDI-V and gNDI-T trimers.

records.full_caption: Fig. 2. (a) The optimized molecular geometries and dihedral angles of NDI-based trimers. The red and blue circles present the distance between the O atom from NDI and the H atom from the vinylene or thiophene unit. (b) Torsion energy profiles of the gNDI-V and gNDI-T trimers. (c) Energy levels and visualization of LUMOs and HOMOs of NDI-based trimers.
records.caption: The optimized molecular geometries and dihedral angles of NDI-based trimers. The red and blue circles present the distance between the O atom from NDI and the H atom from the vinylene or thiophene unit.

records.full_caption: Fig. 1. (a) UV-vis-NIR absorption spectra of NDI-based copolymers. (b) Cyclic voltammetry of the polymer films in 0.1 M tetrabutylammonium hexafluorophosphate (n-Bu4NPF6) acetonitrile solution at a scan rate of 100 mV s−1.
records.caption: Cyclic voltammetry of the polymer films in 0.1 M tetrabutylammonium hexafluorophosphate (n-Bu4NPF6) acetonitrile solution at a scan rate of 100 mV s−1.

Fig. 4 Reversible charging of (a) gNDI-V (−0.65 V to 0.65 V) and (b) gNDI-T (−0.50 V to 0.50 V) with 0.1 M KClaq electrolyte over 150 cycles at a scan rate of 100 mV s−1. The arrows indicate scan directions. (c) gNDI-V and (d) gNDI-T were measured by CV measurements at different scan rates from 10 to 1000 mV s−1, and the extracted peak current density in CVs is shown as a function of the square roots of scan rates.
records.caption: gNDI-T were measured by CV measurements at different scan rates from 10 to 1000 mV s−1, and the extracted peak current density in CVs is shown as a function of the square roots of scan rates.

records.caption: gNDI-T (−0.50 V to 0.50 V) with 0.1 M KClaq electrolyte over 150 cycles at a scan rate of 100 mV s−1. The arrows indicate scan directions.

records.full_caption: Fig. 5 (a) Spectroelectrochemical measurements of NDI copolymers, monitoring the evolution of the absorption spectra of polymer thin films between +0.1 V and −0.7 V vs. Ag/AgCl at a scan rate of 100 mV s−1, voltage step of 0.1 V. (b) Integrals of the polaron absorption and the ICT absorption with the charging period from 0.1 V to −0.7 V vs. Ag/AgCl in 0.1 M KCl aqueous solution. (c) Time-dependent transmittance changes during bleaching (−0.7 V) and coloration (0.1 V) of electrochromic properties based on gNDI-V and gNDI-T, recorded at 532 nm and 623 nm, respectively.
records.caption: Integrals of the polaron absorption and the ICT absorption with the charging period from 0.1 V to −0.7 V vs. Ag/AgCl in 0.1 M KCl aqueous solution.

records.full_caption: Fig. 5 (a) Spectroelectrochemical measurements of NDI copolymers, monitoring the evolution of the absorption spectra of polymer thin films between +0.1 V and −0.7 V vs. Ag/AgCl at a scan rate of 100 mV s−1, voltage step of 0.1 V. (b) Integrals of the polaron absorption and the ICT absorption with the charging period from 0.1 V to −0.7 V vs. Ag/AgCl in 0.1 M KCl aqueous solution. (c) Time-dependent transmittance changes during bleaching (−0.7 V) and coloration (0.1 V) of electrochromic properties based on gNDI-V and gNDI-T, recorded at 532 nm and 623 nm, respectively.

records.full_caption: Fig. 6 (a and b) Output characteristics of OECTs based on gNDI-V and gNDI-T; (c and d) Transfer curve and transconductance gm of the OECTs based on gNDI-V and gNDI-T. Devices were performed at a drain bias of VDS = 0.4 V with a 0.1 M KCl aqueous electrolyte. (e) Plots of the transconductance against channel geometry and operation parameters to extract the associated μC*. (f) The figure of merit μC* for n-type NDI-based copolymers as a function of electron mobility (μe).
records.caption: Transfer curve and transconductance gm of the OECTs based on gNDI-T. Devices were performed at a drain bias of VDS = 0.4 V with a 0.1 M KCl aqueous electrolyte.
